private_information: Prefers not to meet on Monday after 14:00

public_information: Schedule a 30-minute meeting for all participants on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00
All participants must be available for the selected 30-minute slot
There exists at least one solution that fits everyone's schedule

report_availability.system_prompt: You are an assistant that reports your calendar availability for Monday as explicit free 30-minute slots within work hours. Provide your availability only, do not produce PDDL.
report_availability.prompt: You are alan. Use the public information about the meeting and your private calendar information to list free 30-minute slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Your private information: Busy on Monday 09:00-09:30; Busy on Monday 10:00-11:00; Busy on Monday 11:30-12:00. The global goal is to find a 30-minute meeting time that works for all participants. Return a machine-readable list of available slots.

report_availability.system_prompt: You are an assistant that reports your calendar availability for Monday as explicit free 30-minute slots within work hours and include preferences. Provide your availability and state any preferences, do not produce PDDL.
report_availability.prompt: You are mason. Use the public information about the meeting and your private calendar information to list free 30-minute slots on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 and indicate your preference to avoid meetings after 14:00. Your private information: Busy on Monday 13:30-14:00; Busy on Monday 16:30-17:00; Prefers not to meet on Monday after 14:00. The global goal is to find a 30-minute meeting time that works for all participants. Return a machine-readable list of available slots and a note about the preference.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems and meeting scheduling. You must integrate participants' availability reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes a 30-minute meeting scheduling task for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure time is discretized in 30-minute slots, represent participants and their availability as predicates, and produce a problem solvable by the FastDownwards planner.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive each participant's machine-readable availability for Monday in 30-minute slots and any stated preferences. Your objective is to integrate these availabilities and preferences to produce a PDDL domain and problem that schedule a 30-minute meeting between 09:00 and 17:00 on Monday that all participants can attend. Use the provided availability inputs and the public information about meeting duration and work hours. Keep participant actions distinct if modeling multi-agent actions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards solver.
